definition: top priority job/matter of vital importance
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious

sentences.english: India obviously has preoccupations enough to keep its focus fixed on its border regions.
sentences.chinese: 印度的当务之急显然是把焦点定在边界地区。

sentences.english: But buttering up China appears to be a new priority.
sentences.chinese: 但显然向中国示好成为其当务之急。

sentences.english: I think the first order of business is to get you out of here.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，当务之急首先是得把你撵出去。

sentences.english: For him, tackling climate change is every bit as urgent.
sentences.chinese: 但在他看来，应对气候变化同样是当务之急。

sentences.english: Its urgent for telecommunication enterprises in China to emphasize and implement marketing research.
sentences.chinese: 重视和开展市场调研是国内电信企业的当务之急。

sentences.english: On the correct application of market research in enterprises marketing;
sentences.chinese: 重视和开展市场调研是国内电信企业的当务之急。

sentences.english: I believe now that cooperation is everything.
sentences.chinese: 我认为当务之急是要通力合作。

sentences.english: Now he believed that mitigating the impact of rising temperatures was urgent.
sentences.chinese: 如今，他坚信减轻气温升高的影响是当务之急。

sentences.english: What is pressing at present is to resume the negotiation as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 当务之急是争取尽快复谈。

sentences.english: The environmental management of coal waste has become an impending problem.
sentences.chinese: 煤矸石的环境治理问题已成当务之急。

sentences.english: The necessity for making decisions devolves on him.
sentences.chinese: 作出决策乃当务之急，此事必然地落在他身上。

sentences.english: Encourage farmers to macro-control of cotton is a matter of urgency.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励农民种棉是宏观调控的当务之急。

sentences.english: Now the urgent task is to make sure you get vigilante thing right.
sentences.chinese: 现在的当务之急是务必把“治安维持会”的事情办好。

sentences.english: The task of promptly building up an administrative system of criminal science and technology is of top priority.
sentences.chinese: 建立新型刑事科学技术管理体制是当务之急。

sentences.english: State-owned commercial banks improve customer loyalty become an urgency matter.
sentences.chinese: 提高国有商业银行的客户忠诚度成为当务之急。

sentences.english: The priority for policymakers must be to keep the number of losers as small as possible.
sentences.chinese: 决策者的当务之急是尽量减少这些失意者的数量。

definition: circumstances require action (idiom); absolutely necessary/imperative
as quickly as possible/as soon as possible/with all speed
see 儘快|尽快[jin3 kuai4]
the most important/of chief importance
to take one's time making a decision (idiom)/to consider at length
the best policy/the best thing one can do in the circumstances
key task/important affair
pressing in on one's eyelashes (idiom); imminent
as early as possible
now/at present/subocular (medicine)
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
important/urgent
sensible act
of the utmost importance/of highest priority
eager to/in a hurry to
to brook no delay/to demand immediate action
to try/to make an attempt/to think of a way (to accomplish sth)
